00034 /** @file llvmutil.h
00035     @brief Header file with declarations for various LLVM utility stuff
00036 */
00037 
00038 #ifndef ISPC_LLVMUTIL_H
00039 #define ISPC_LLVMUTIL_H 1
00040 
00041 #include "ispc.h"
00042 #include <llvm/LLVMContext.h>
00043 #include <llvm/Type.h>
00044 #include <llvm/DerivedTypes.h>
00045 #include <llvm/Constants.h>
00046 
00047 /** This structure holds pointers to a variety of LLVM types; code
00048     elsewhere can use them from here, ratherthan needing to make more
00049     verbose LLVM API calls.
00050  */ 
00051 struct LLVMTypes {
00052     static const llvm::Type *VoidType;
00053     static const llvm::PointerType *VoidPointerType;
00054     static const llvm::Type *BoolType;
00055     static const llvm::Type *Int8Type;
00056     static const llvm::Type *Int16Type;
00057     static const llvm::Type *Int32Type;
00058     static const llvm::Type *Int32PointerType;
00059     static const llvm::Type *Int64Type;
00060     static const llvm::Type *Int64PointerType;
00061     static const llvm::Type *FloatType;
00062     static const llvm::Type *FloatPointerType;
00063     static const llvm::Type *DoubleType;
00064 
00065     static const llvm::VectorType *MaskType;
00066     static const llvm::VectorType *BoolVectorType;
00067     static const llvm::VectorType *Int1VectorType;
00068     static const llvm::VectorType *Int32VectorType;
00069     static const llvm::Type *Int32VectorPointerType;
00070     static const llvm::VectorType *Int64VectorType;
00071     static const llvm::Type *Int64VectorPointerType;
00072     static const llvm::VectorType *FloatVectorType;
00073     static const llvm::Type *FloatVectorPointerType;
00074     static const llvm::VectorType *DoubleVectorType;
00075     static const llvm::ArrayType *VoidPointerVectorType;
00076 };
00077 
00078 /** These variables hold the corresponding LLVM constant values as a
00079     convenience to code elsewhere in the system.
00080  */
00081 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMTrue, *LLVMFalse;
00082 
00083 /** This should be called early in initialization to initialize the members
00084     of LLVMTypes and the LLVMTrue/LLVMFalse constants.  However, it can't
00085     be called until the compilation target is known.
00086  */
00087 extern void InitLLVMUtil(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx, Target target);
00088 
00089 /** Returns an LLVM i32 constant of the given value */
00090 extern llvm::ConstantInt *LLVMInt32(int32_t i);
00091 /** Returns an LLVM i32 constant of the given value */
00092 extern llvm::ConstantInt *LLVMUInt32(uint32_t i);
00093 /** Returns an LLVM i64 constant of the given value */
00094 extern llvm::ConstantInt *LLVMInt64(int64_t i);
00095 /** Returns an LLVM i64 constant of the given value */
00096 extern llvm::ConstantInt *LLVMUInt64(uint64_t i);
00097 /** Returns an LLVM float constant of the given value */
00098 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMFloat(float f);
00099 /** Returns an LLVM double constant of the given value */
00100 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMDouble(double f);
00101 
00102 /** Returns an LLVM boolean vector constant of the given value smeared
00103     across all elements */
00104 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMBoolVector(bool v);
00105 /** Returns an LLVM i32 vector constant of the given value smeared
00106     across all elements */
00107 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMInt32Vector(int32_t i);
00108 /** Returns an LLVM i32 vector constant of the given value smeared
00109     across all elements */
00110 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMUInt32Vector(uint32_t i);
00111 /** Returns an LLVM i64 vector constant of the given value smeared
00112     across all elements */
00113 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMInt64Vector(int64_t i);
00114 /** Returns an LLVM i64 vector constant of the given value smeared
00115     across all elements */
00116 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMUInt64Vector(uint64_t i);
00117 /** Returns an LLVM float vector constant of the given value smeared
00118     across all elements */
00119 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMFloatVector(float f);
00120 /** Returns an LLVM double vector constant of the given value smeared
00121     across all elements */
00122 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMDoubleVector(double f);
00123 
00124 /** Returns an LLVM boolean vector based on the given array of values.
00125     The array should have g->target.vectorWidth elements. */
00126 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMBoolVector(const bool *v);
00127 /** Returns an LLVM i32 vector based on the given array of values.
00128     The array should have g->target.vectorWidth elements. */
00129 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMInt32Vector(const int32_t *i);
00130 /** Returns an LLVM i32 vector based on the given array of values.
00131     The array should have g->target.vectorWidth elements. */
00132 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMUInt32Vector(const uint32_t *i);
00133 /** Returns an LLVM i64 vector based on the given array of values.
00134     The array should have g->target.vectorWidth elements. */
00135 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMInt64Vector(const int64_t *i);
00136 /** Returns an LLVM i64 vector based on the given array of values.
00137     The array should have g->target.vectorWidth elements. */
00138 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMUInt64Vector(const uint64_t *i);
00139 /** Returns an LLVM float vector based on the given array of values.
00140     The array should have g->target.vectorWidth elements. */
00141 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMFloatVector(const float *f);
00142 /** Returns an LLVM double vector based on the given array of values.
00143     The array should have g->target.vectorWidth elements. */
00144 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMDoubleVector(const double *f);
00145 
00146 /** LLVM constant value representing an 'all on' SIMD lane mask */
00147 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMMaskAllOn;
00148 /** LLVM constant value representing an 'all off' SIMD lane mask */
00149 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMMaskAllOff;
00150 
00151 /** Given an LLVM type, returns the corresponding type for a vector of
00152     pointers to that type.  (In practice, an array of pointers, since LLVM
00153     prohibits vectors of pointers.
00154  */
00155 extern const llvm::ArrayType *LLVMPointerVectorType(const llvm::Type *t);
00156 
00157 #endif // ISPC_LLVMUTIL_H
